title: SoK Paper: Power Side-Channel Malware Detection
relevance_to_wifi_har: Limited - Power-based malware detection in embedded systems
technical_approach: Systematization of power side-channel detectors with ensemble one-class classification
key_contributions: Comprehensive taxonomy of 23 power-based malware detection works
Identification of three research gaps: parallel evaluation, ML formulation, public datasets
Novel ensemble detector using mode-specific one-class classifiers
Public dataset release for multi-core embedded malware detection

cross_domain_applicability.ensemble_methods: High - Mode-specific classifier combinations applicable to multi-activity HAR
cross_domain_applicability.evaluation_framework: High - Comprehensive testing across all operating conditions
cross_domain_applicability.feature_engineering: Medium - Statistical features applicable to CSI analysis
cross_domain_applicability.ml_formulation_critique: High - Critical assessment of appropriate ML approaches

stability_analysis.single_task_performance: Good - Existing methods effective in controlled environments
stability_analysis.multi_task_degradation: Significant - Performance loss in concurrent execution scenarios
stability_analysis.noise_handling: Addressed through preprocessing and ensemble approaches

practical_deployment.scalability: Limited - Performance decreases with system complexity
practical_deployment.real_time_capability: Feasible - 2 KHz sampling rate with lightweight classifiers
practical_deployment.hardware_requirements: Moderate - Current sensor and embedded computing platform

verification_status.reproducibility: Good - Public dataset and implementation details provided

cross_domain_insights: Mode-specific classifier training applicable to activity-specific HAR models
Ensemble approaches could enhance multi-person activity recognition
Systematic evaluation framework valuable for WiFi HAR validation
Statistical feature engineering techniques applicable to CSI analysis
